Overwiew Duck Game is a 2D  fast paced multiplayer shooter that faces up to four ducks in a head-to-head tournament to reach the score limit, which is achieved by winning each round.

Combat Duck Game has combat that results in a fast paced round almost every time you play. It features one-hit weapons that will surely finish your opponents with ease, while also leaving you to play tactically so that you dont end up victim of those who face you.
There is a vast array of weaponry to take out your foes with, such as the devastating minigun, land mines, revolvers, and even bananas to make your opponents slip. Every weapon will kill you instantly if hit, unless you happen to find armor sprawled around the map.
One of the most talked about features in the game is the dedicated button for quaking, which is great for many things such as taunting your opponents or breaking the silence in an awkward situation. Another great feature is the ability to ragdoll your character, which when used at the right moment may lead others to believe you are dead, giving you an advantage  or  leaving you vulnerable to be picked up and possibly thrown off the map or into a trap.

Conclusion  Duck game is well worth it's price in my opinion. Playing with friends will lead to a great time, and quite possibly an ended friendship. Overall, the game is well done and it may be one of my favorite games of this year.

I rate it an 10/10, would quack again

Serious review time.

Duck Game is a sidescrolling 2D free-for-all multiplayer platforming shooter. A fairly complex one at that, in fact complexity is the keyword here, it's what keeps the game fresh and at the same time somewhat inaccessible, more about that later.

Watching the trailer, it might seem like a complete clusterduck, and that's what it is, but it's an organized clusterduck, and it's genuinely fun. What I'm trying to say is that this isn't a gimmick game. It doesn't exist solely for youtubers to hit the quack button repeatedly (keep in mind quacking is still an integral and inseparable part of the experience). There is a reason to keep coming back to this game even after the novelty of hearing the same soundfile over and over wears off.

The crux of gameplay is that you are thrown into the fray with up to 3 opponents, last one standing wins. Generally you start off with no weapons at all and you have to race to obtain them before your opponents do. Most maps are built in such a way that you have either no or very weak weapons near your spawn location, with more powerful ones placed further away, hidden in bizarre places or even locked away.

When it comes to weapons themselves, as the trailer says, there is an irresponsible amount, and that's a big part of the complexity of the game. Each weapon works in a different way and to remain at least a bit competitive, you have to be able to properly use all of them, the whole irresponsible amount of them. Not talking about pro level duckgame MLG 1v1 ladder invite prem clan level, just to make it through the average casual match without dying first every single round which is barely any fun.

To elaborate on the weapons, they work in somewhat eccentric ways. For instance, you have to pump pump action shotguns after shooting them, and forgetting to do so can be fatal. You might find yourself successfully throwing a grenade to find out it's not going off for some reason, then have somebody pick it up, pull the pin, then throw it back at you. Reloading muskets, blunderbusses and bazookas is a very realistic process, and can't be cancelled, making you a sitting duck (pun very intended). >>>>>Click Here For Video Impressions<<<<<

Duck Game is a very special game.  It's a game designed for everyone, but especially crafted for anyone who grew up in the Couch Multiplayer era, specifically Sega Genesis fans.  It's a game with simple mechanics and an endless supply of frantic over the top fun.

The rules are simple, first to 10 match victories wins!  Matches generally last about 10-30 seconds, after which the next one starts up almost immediately on a randomly selected map.  The rhythm of the game is almost never broken up, keeping a quick and exciting pace throughout.  There's an ungodly amount of weapons, each with their own variety and mechanics.  You'll find everything from Derringers, to Shotguns, to Nerf Guns, to Mooninite Lasers!

Although the main draw of this game is easily the Multiplayer, the Single-Player challenges offer you a chance to train your skills through a series of modes.  These challenges give you major insights into lesser known mechanics of the game, which can give you that little edge in combat.  Through winning challenges you get Tickets, which you can spend not only to buy hats, but also GAMEPLAY MODIFIERS for multiplayer!

Did I mention there's a dedicated Quack Button? That can be pressed at any time. Seriously. It's the best thing ever.

So grab this game, grab some friends, grab some RPGs, and let the feathers fly!

reviewText:
Duck Game is great.

How great? That really depends on several factors. If I was comparing this with anything else, it would be asking if you like Super Smash Brothers. Super Smash Brothers, in my opinion is only 5/10 if you’re by yourself, but a solid 10/10 when you get a couple guys to play with. Duck Game fares similarly, being a competitive, 2D, PVP focused game with skill based platforming and reaction time. The difference is that Duck Game has the one hit kill intensity found in Samurai Gunn. The kicker is that you can’t attack if you don’t have a weapon, so the start of the match is just a rapid scrambling for firearms and panicked firing. It’s an intense, skill based shootout that I hope to be playing for the next 10 years at least.

Duck Game’s true greatness is its subtleties present in its design. At first it may seem constraining to not be able to aim in all directions like you would expect, but you eventually find that if you’re pressed up against an object your duck aims upward, still allowing you to fire. A particular gun that looks like a giant magnum recoils with each shot, letting you aim slightly higher to hit enemies, essentially you exploit a handling characteristic of the weapon into a game mechanic. The ducks can even float around on stubby wings and slide on their knees if you duck while running (ha ha), allowing you to do Matrix-like dodges against your enemies. Really great stuff, with a high skill ceiling but still easy enough to allow new players to get the drop on more experienced ones, which is the “sweet spot” I adore in competitive games. There’s a button completed dedicated to quacking (SERIOUSLY) which adds a layer of absurdity and humor to the already ridiculous setting that Duck Game takes place in.

One fear I have is the staying power of the online community. Too many indie games, have I bought on a super-sale only to see that the fan base has since moved on to other games. Duck Game is still relatively new as of 6/22/2015, so finding a game isn’t too difficult, but I really, really REALLY hope this game has longevity in the future. Like I said, 10 years please. One of the upsides this game has over Samurai Gunn is its near perfect online gameplay, which I hope keeps the game alive. I only had a couple of disconnects but the lag never really messed with me too bad. Even if the online dies out, with the local play, all it requires really is a couple of controllers and a few brewskies to have a great time. I love this game.

Adult Swim Games never fails to impress me. They have a great catalog of games that they have published. Despite this, I was skeptical about Duck Game. The concept seemed silly. However as multiplayer is the primary draw here. It's something to keep in mind. If your looking for a good way to blow off steam with friends or online. Duck Game is great choice for a party game. reviewText: I've never laughed so much at unintentional humor while playing a game. It feels like a mix of Blackthorne and smash brothers. I first heard about it from TotalBiscuit , and have been in love with it ever since.\nThe multiplayer is where the real fun is at, where up to four people play either free-for-all or on teams until they're the last duck(s) standing. It only takes one hit to kill another duck, so there's a lot of strategy involved in trying to kill other ducks while keeping yourself alive. The weapons are quite varied, but far from useless. A dueling pistol only able to fire a single shot a few feet against a chain gun sounds like a bad matchup, but you'd be surprise what you can accomplish with some quick moves and a little bit of mind games thrown in.\nThe single player is also very well done. While it's just a set of levels with goals and timers, it becomes addicting to try to get the best medal on all of them, and unlock as many hats and game modifiers as possible. It's also a great way to learn all the ins and outs of the gameplay so you're better prepared for the chaos that ensues in multiplayer.

reviewText: This game is perfect for those who love 2D side scrollers with deathmatch added to it. In it, you can have a match with up to 4 people and be on teams or play free for all. You spawn in randomly in a small map that you can see all the time and you need to find weapons in '!' blocks. Obviously once you find a weapon, you need to go find your target. Each round lasts about 20 seconds (because 1 hit = insta death unless you find armor). The goal is to get the most points by the end of the game. Not to mention therer is hats. You can either unlock hats, download them from the Workshop, or make your own and share it with friends. Also, there is a level editor. Once you finished your level, you can upload it to the workshop just like you can with hats. I usually play about 100 rounds before taking a break when playing this game, and just because the rounds are short doesn't mean you will get bored quicker. Its just fast pace, where you want to play your cards right and avoid anything that can kill you. Did I mention that there is a mind control weapon located in certain maps? It lets you take control of your opponent if you can manage to sap them with the beams and make them jump off a cliff. I did this and managed to make 3 of the other ducks drop their weapons and walk off cliffs. This is unique and coded very nicely. Each time I launch it I notice I burn a few hours of my day away on it. Lastly, there is arcade. Just a place where you can go pratice your skills on non-moving ducks. Over all, this is a great game.

Duck game is hilarious and entertaining for a local gaming night. It can even be enjoyed solo with the challenge mode.

The idea of four ducks spawning in a platformed arena and having to duke it out to the death has never been more satisfying. Rounds may last 5 seconds to a minute. It's designed to be frantic and fun.

If you run out of maps or need somewhere fresh to frag each other, The steam workshop hosts a strong community of user made maps. The Level Editor is a little tricky to understand at first, but once you get the hang of it, you too may contribute your own content to the workshop for others to play on.

Fans of Sega Mega Drive will adore the nostaglic sound palette and familiar backgrounds and landscapes too. Hooray for Retrogamers!

The idea of four ducks spawning in a platformed arena and having to duke it out to the death has never been more satisfying. Rounds may last 5 seconds to a minute. It's designed to be frantic and fun.

If you run out of maps or need somewhere fresh to frag each other, The steam workshop hosts a strong community of user made maps. The Level Editor is a little tricky to understand at first, but once you get the hang of it, you too may contribute your own content to the workshop for others to play on.

Fans of Sega Mega Drive will adore the nostaglic sound palette and familiar backgrounds and landscapes too. Hooray for Retrogamers!

reviewText:
I hear that lists are hip and cool with the kids, so here goes:

Hugely enjoyable gameplay that never gets old and has lots of nice touches.
Approachable enough to just pick up and play immediately, but harbors enough depth to keep veteran gamers interested
Solid level design with a level editor and tons of user-created levels on offer
Good modding support
Responsive controller controls
Good netcode, but gameplay is so fast-paced that there's unavoidable sensitivity to lag. No server browser yet (matchmaking is automatic).
Not buggy. Most of the bugs are just amusing rather than taking away from your experience. Duck Game has its occasional crashes (what game doesn't?), but they're almost always caused by alt-tabbing in and out.
Still being patched and content is still being added. Devs are friendly and responsive on the forums.
Arcade time-trial SP mode which isn't as good as MP, but that's only because MP is so good. Offers a good challenge and a chance to hone some useful skills to use in MP.
Advice to anyone thinking of purchasing Duck Game:

A controller is highly, highly recommended. The keyboard controls are pretty crap.
The vanilla levels have a lot of RNG in them. If that's not your thing, you can hand-pick a list of Steam Workshop levels and play those.
The playerbase outside the US isn't very big. If you live somewhere that's not the US, you will probably have some trouble finding games. You can play with Americans by changing your download region.
Overall, it's worth your $13. I could have paid $30 and I still would feel like I got my money's worth and then some. Highly recommended, especially if you have friends to play with.

Obligatory self-plug: learn how to dominate the singleplayer mode with my video guides. https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwP2w-CvTMwMdEUiVznXlL0IMakAnOLIF

Highly recommended.

reviewText:
After gettin almost every achievement and completing the singleplayer with every challenge on platinum + massive offline AND online sessions, heres my advice:

If you are a fan of 2D arcade/competetive/funny/gun blazin/ducky games , DUCK GAME is a must-buy!

The singleplayer-challenges are a good training for every small duckling who starts the game the first time and even after hours, some of them are really challenging your skills. You got a variety of aiming, racing, and even small missions where you have to pay quite some attention HOW you use the givin weaponry to complete them.

Multiplayer is the real deal for Duck Game. Whether its offline, sittin next to each other and blow your ducks to feathers and roast, or online. The matchmaking is good and fast, suffers only from people with a high ping = the game starts lagging -> You had the gun on your screen, but suddenly the other duck shoots you with it. You can avoid that easily by checking the pings in lobby and dodge those guys.
The game has its own situation comedy and humor you cant help but laugh or at least, if you are really grumpy, smirk about. Thats a major part of the longtime motivation, i played up to this review 30 hours + and it wasnt boring a second. I gonna start soon building my own maps with the level editor, which is a bit fiddly but after a while you will get it.

The other major part is the gameplay. Dozens of different,  hillarious weapons are waitin for you to use them in every way you can imagine. Burning nerf-blaster, slippery bananas into motion-sensored mines, minigun-jetpack-combos and way more. Over all: The absolute direct, snappy and handy controlling (i recommend a controller, not the keyboard), just the right tool to perform something like jumping of a high edge and sniping a duck halfway across the map through a door, mid-air of course.

Still not convinced? There is an extra button for quacking (with a controller you can even pitch your quacks) AND ----- Hats. A s***load of hats. Trust me, its worth the money!

Thats it for me. So, see you online, let the better one moonwalk and quack at the end!

reviewText:
For 2-player Local gameplay see here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qiQ-KB0w-FM

The first reaction to seeing Duck Game in action tends to be a prolonged “WTF!?”. The second reaction is equally as entertaining. Once the shock settles, a near permanent smile sets on your face and the faces of those watching and you can hear genuine excitement in those whoops and shouts of delight as you annihilate your opponents to the oh so sweet quack, quack, quacking of the winner. I am not going to beat about the bush here. This game is silly. This game is fun. This game could very easily be THE multiplayer video-game of 2015.

Released previously on what many consider the now defunct Ouya, Duck Game hits windows Steam harder than Donald Duck does English. Featuring a 2 and 4 player local couch co-op, single player challenge modes and for this new release a 2 to 4 player online battle also. With over 50 pre-built levels and over 50 weapons of various hilarity inducing carnage plus a built in level creator the game offers much to keep the gamer interested. It doesn’t really matter though as this game is so much fun to play you never really get fed up of a set level.

It plays fast and furious, slick and silly, and whilst the gameplay may not venture above running around a 2D platform, picking up weapons, throwing grenades and causing general mayhem, it perfects the genre. It looks fantastic with its ‘old skool’ retro-gaming feel and sounds like you are back in those 80s arcades that many of us grew up with and many others wish they had too.

This is Indie gaming done proper. A small idea turned on edgeways, a dash of laughter, perfect controls and fluid gameplay. The Dev, Landon Podbielski will hopefully rake in the kind of money that would make Scrooge McDuck blush and it’s publishers, Adult Swim Games, should court Landon until he comes up with more of these gems. I really do have a hard time criticising this game but in an effort to come across as balanced and not an utter fanboy… No, sorry, I just cannot fault it. Sure, you can lose in the very first second but even then it is still fun to watch the ensuing slaughter. With practice those insta deaths tail away into memory and you find yourself being a little more cautious as you start thinking tactfully and stop running hell for leather over the edge. Running like a mad dog straight for your opponent with a live grenade that will take you both out though, well that never get’s old.
Despite the obvious violence at play here the whole thing is one big cartoon of jetpacking Ducks and because of this some of you may wish to try the game yourself before assuming it will be ok for the younger generation, the only problem with this is that you are unlikely to want to give it back once you played it too. reviewText:
After gettin almost every achievement and completing the singleplayer with every challenge on platinum + massive offline AND online sessions, heres my advice:

If you are a fan of 2D arcade/competetive/funny/gun blazin/ducky games , DUCK GAME is a must-buy!

The singleplayer-challenges are a good training for every small duckling who starts the game the first time and even after hours, some of them are really challenging your skills. You got a variety of aiming, racing, and even small missions where you have to pay quite some attention HOW you use the givin weaponry to complete them.

Multiplayer is the real deal for Duck Game. Whether its offline, sittin next to each other and blow your ducks to feathers and roast, or online. The matchmaking is good and fast, suffers only from people with a high ping = the game starts lagging -> You had the gun on your screen, but suddenly the other duck shoots you with it. You can avoid that easily by checking the pings in lobby and dodge those guys.
The game has its own situation comedy and humor you cant help but laugh or at least, if you are really grumpy, smirk about. Thats a major part of the longtime motivation, i played up to this review 30 hours + and it wasnt boring a second. I gonna start soon building my own maps with the level editor, which is a bit fiddly but after a while you will get it.

The other major part is the gameplay. Dozens of different,  hillarious weapons are waitin for you to use them in every way you can imagine. Burning nerf-blaster, slippery bananas into motion-sensored mines, minigun-jetpack-combos and way more. Over all: The absolute direct, snappy and handy controlling (i recommend a controller, not the keyboard), just the right tool to perform something like jumping of a high edge and sniping a duck halfway across the map through a door, mid-air of course.

Still not convinced? There is an extra button for quacking (with a controller you can even pitch your quacks) AND ----- Hats. A s***load of hats. Trust me, its worth the money!

Thats it for me. So, see you online, let the better one moonwalk and quack at the end!
